content.description: Long moderate slab route up water grooved face.
content.location: From the top of the stairs walk left. This is the right of the two bolted routes 30 feet before the dihedral.

content.description: The first couple bolts are a bit tricky. A slab dyno (or at least a little hop) might be required to reach some holds.
content.location: From the top of the trail walk left. This is the bolted route right of the dihedral.

climbs.name: Sacred Stones
climbs.fa: Jared Hancock, Rob Copeland, James Case  2005

content.description: Tough start, stick clipping the first bolt is highly recommended. A crucial hold broke off after the first accent so traversing in from the right is the only way this thing is 11c. After reaching the first bolt continue up through some tough to read decipher moves.
content.location: At the top of the trail head left. This is the first bolted route to the left of the dihedral.

climbs.name: Return to Balance
climbs.fa: Jared Hancock, Skip Wolfe, Mark Ryan - 2005

content.location: far left side of wall climbs the line of bolts in the obvious dish dihedral.

content.description: Wandering toprope route between Child of the Earth and Sacred Stones.
content.location: Between Child of the Earth and Sacred Stones.

content.description:
Climb up to the bottom of the massive hueco and follow the right side of it until the route veers out onto the face. Creep out onto small holds and pull hard up to the anchor.

Ray Ellington on Kipp's state at the time of the FA, "I couldn't believe he did it. He had some nasty bronchial infection and was falling on 5.11 just hours before from being so sick and weak. Then he goes out and sends this project," giving the route its name.

There is also a direct line of bolts that may have not seen an ascent yet.
content.location: As the approach trail meets the cliff, this is located just to the right. Look for the massive black hueco that it follows at the start.

climbs.name: Go West
climbs.fa: Joel Bruhn, Jared Hancock, Rob Copeland 2004

content.description: Take care with the start (ie, place good gear and don't pop off). The rest of the climb is excellent and fun. Great moves up high.
content.protection: Small and medium gear. Bolt anchors.
content.location: Obvious dihedral left of Thrillbillies slab.

content.description: Thin and bouldery finger crack follows an obvious line up the wall. Crux is at about midway up the route and it (along with the rest of the route) involves a combination of jams and face holds. Fantastic line and safe line to try and break into the grade.
content.protection: Small cams and nuts. Bomber gear and can easily double up protection at the crux. Crack thins to a seam in places but many pods provide placements
content.location: Obvious thin crack left of the large dark hueco and about 40 feet right of Thrillabies

content.description: Thin and crimpy up high.  Fun route.
